title: Tristana VU feedback
body:
Unfortunately, I have a few problems with Tristana. Well, actually just one:

**She doesn't look like Tristana. Or a Yordle, for that matter.**

I *think* this has got to do with her face, ears and body shape. 

* Live Tristana has a **square**-ish face, while PBE Tristana's is **triangular**. All other Yordles have **square** or **round** faces.
* Live Tristana's ears point **backwards**, while PBE Tristana's point **to the sides**.
* Live Tristana's body is **child-like** and **fully covered**, while PBE Tristana appears to have a **hourglass figure** and a **bared midriff**. All other Yordles are **child-like** and **fully covered**.

If you'd make Tristana's jaw squarer, turn her ears so that they point backwards, and cover her midriff (and/or make her body look more like Lulu's), I think it would help a lot with her readability and visual cohesion with the other Yordles.

replies.body:
You seem to be under the assumption that we wanted to adhere to design elements (intentional or not) that are prevalent on old Tristana. That is not the case. We're redefining as we go. The things you've identified are precisely the things we targeted to make new Tristana unique but fall in line with the future of Yordles as a whole.

Right now we're forging ahead with a different idea as to what Yordles are and what they look like. Tristana is only the beginning quite honestly.

> [{quoted}](name=IronStylus,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=uplTyxNG,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-01-16T09:53:49.436+0000)
>
> You seem to be under the assumption that we wanted to adhere to design elements (intentional or not) that are prevalent on old Tristana. That is not the case. We're redefining as we go. The things you've identified are precisely the things we targeted to make new Tristana unique but fall in line with the future of Yordles as a whole.
> 
> Right now we're forging ahead with a different idea as to what Yordles are and what they look like. Tristana is only the beginning quite honestly.

I agree with you that you should be redefining what the Yordles look like, that what is old and unneeded should be discarded if it can be made to clarify what we are meaning to see and helping establish worldbuilding and create a baseline for designs for a unique race of League of Legends.

I don't think old Tristana ever resembled a Yordle even post the Megling retcon, but I don't think the redesign for Tristana was enough. It's a good start, but I don't feel she's a Yordle, despite sexual dimorphism being the reason on why she looks different. What immediately stands out to me are how drastically different she is in comparison to the Yordles and how many similarities she has with Fizz, a being of no established race. 

What immediately caught my eye about Tristana's redesign is how differently proportioned and physically different she is in comparison to any of the male Yordles. Aside from only having fur on her ears (and I suppose her head), she has blue, smooth skin and a very feminine body shape, hips included, compared to any of the squat male Yordles. Her eyes are also much larger than most of the male Yordles, save for perhaps Ziggs, and the entire facial structure of Tristana feels very similar to that of an Asura from Guild Wars.

Sexual dimorphism seen in nature, such as cardinals, doesn't make it confusing as to what species it is: They are both birds, though one is red and one is more of dull peach color. Spiders the same, one may be larger than the other, but you won't mistake a spider to be a fish.

This is my current problem with Tristana: she looks more similar to Fizz in every sense than she does look to be a Yordle. They're blue smooth skin, giant cartoony eyes, short but lithe, curvilinear distinctly humanoid bodytype with big, almost drooping ears (or ear-like appendages).

Any of the male Yordles have squat, squished body features, various fur patterns and are much more animalistic in their appearance.

I think Tristana's design could have been pushed further, to completely eradicate any remnants of "Megling" because she is, by far and large, not a Megling anymore and nothing should evoke it. 

My problem with all of the female yordles has been that I don't immediately associate them with the Yordle race, I have to remind  myself that they are the same species when the truth of the matter is that Tristana was not originally designed to look like a Yordle, was not designed to be a Yordle, and was designed to be a different race hence the blue skin and white hair that both she and Poppy have.

I almost feel like some hints of fur on her body, or even having a Calico cat pattern on her skin, something that removed the last traces of the Megling race that has not been relevant for more than 5 years would have helped differentiating Tristana from her old shackles and helped the Yordle unification much more.

Currently you're only judging her against 1 formalized and 1 semi-formalized male yordles. Hiemer and Ziggs. Both are in many ways distortions and deformations, especially Hiemer. I wouldn't treat him as yordle baseline, just as you don't want to treat Lulu or anyone before her as baseline. From what we're planning out Tristana is, as of now, the most current and formalized female yordle baseline in terms of anatomy. Others will follow. 

Additionally, male yordles will most likely be more stylized in a sense, though the whole race is a canvas for the wacky. Chances you'll see Poppy follow much more in the shoes (or lack thereof) of Tristana, as will subsequent Yordle designs. I would also even bring the philosophy back to champions like Lulu in terms of females. She might be smaller but she should still have a unification pass.

Let's be real here, we all know that when you update Teemo or any other yordle you will not give him bare wide shoulders and pecks on top of a giant human cat-eared head. You won't, because that kind of uninspired design is reserved for the females. You know, I understand the need to make human female characters attractive, I do, what I don't understand is trying to make characters like these attractive.
Old Tristana was cute and funny and despite the awkward case of humanface fit perfectly among the yordles with her body type. This Trist is your typical female character, except you made her head enormous and for some bizzare reason felt that a midget fuzzball needed to be half naked. We already have a half-naked female pyromaniac. She's called Jinx. Trist is supposed to be a cute ball of destruction, close to Ziggs, except not insane. But for some reason, you just felt that you needed another Jinx.
Also, is it too much t ask for some fur on the female yordles?

> [{quoted}](name=IronStylus,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=uplTyxNG,comment-id=000400050000,timestamp=2015-01-16T23:55:05.934+0000)
>
> Currently you're only judging her against 1 formalized and 1 semi-formalized male yordles. Hiemer and Ziggs. Both are in many ways distortions and deformations, especially Hiemer. I wouldn't treat him as yordle baseline, just as you don't want to treat Lulu or anyone before her as baseline. From what we're planning out Tristana is, as of now, the most current and formalized female yordle baseline in terms of anatomy. Others will follow. 
> 
> Additionally, male yordles will most likely be more stylized in a sense, though the whole race is a canvas for the wacky. Chances you'll see Poppy follow much more in the shoes (or lack thereof) of Tristana, as will subsequent Yordle designs. I would also even bring the philosophy back to champions like Lulu in terms of females. She might be smaller but she should still have a unification pass.

Those are very good points. I hope you didn't take offense to what I said, because I am, like many other players, in the dark about a lot of matters, especially about the Yordles. I am actually really happy you're clarifying questions players do have about the Trist update. 

But I do have two more questions I wish to ask, for the sake of clarification. 

The first is me being completely honest, the truth of the matter is that I wasn't sure if all of the male Yordles were going to be updated along with Trist and Poppy. What I mean by this is not Teemo, he's as old a model as they are and desperately needs an update, but does this mean that Heimerdinger and Ziggs would be receiving a VU in the future as well, or are they to be the baseline for the other male Yordles to follow?

The second question is a character design inquiry, does this guarantee that Poppy will have a different body type/silhouette than Tristana? She may not have boots, but will she have the same lithe body type that Tristana has but with a shield and hammer, or will Poppy be the beefy, stocky Yordle whose hammer can shatter the heavens?

Heimerdinger has already received a VU with the new yordle designs in mind. 

http://wac.7725.edgecastcdn.net/807725/website/wp-content/uploads/2014/02/Q6.jpg

I think Ziggs will receive some anatomy updates, but will otherwise end up looking the same in terms of design.

Poppy will likely be more muscled than Trist, seeing as she's up on the frontlines swinging a giant hammer.
Yeah, well, Leona swings a giant sword and a shield as big as herself and her arms are still as strong as a pair twigs.

> [{quoted}](name=IronStylus,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=uplTyxNG,comment-id=000400050000,timestamp=2015-01-16T23:55:05.934+0000)
>
> Currently you're only judging her against 1 formalized and 1 semi-formalized male yordles. Hiemer and Ziggs. Both are in many ways distortions and deformations, especially Hiemer. I wouldn't treat him as yordle baseline, just as you don't want to treat Lulu or anyone before her as baseline. From what we're planning out Tristana is, as of now, the most current and formalized female yordle baseline in terms of anatomy. Others will follow. 
> 
> Additionally, male yordles will most likely be more stylized in a sense, though the whole race is a canvas for the wacky. Chances you'll see Poppy follow much more in the shoes (or lack thereof) of Tristana, as will subsequent Yordle designs. I would also even bring the philosophy back to champions like Lulu in terms of females. She might be smaller but she should still have a unification pass.

Why can't you just unretcon the Megling Genocide and bring back Corki, Heimer, Tristana, Poppy, Lulu as Meglings instead of disgusting filthy beastly Yordles?

Could even say that Fizz is Megling too who evolved differently

You're comparing Trist to the male yordles, only two of which are of recent design and only one of which is semi-recent in design (aka 3 years old, which is a lot in league time). Every other male yorlde (and female yordle for that matter) is of the "old design", which isnt much of a coherent design to begin with.

Gnar and Heimerdinger are the two recent yordles I speak of. If you're going to compare Trist's anatomy to one of them, it should probably be Gnar, as his anatomy is most similar, just smaller (but I accredit that to him being a relatively young yordle, where I see Trist being a young adult).

You cannot say Trist doesn't look like a yordle while comparing her to old designs, when the point of her redesign is to give a coherent look to all yordles (and the reason they're doing THAT is because, before, they DIDN'T have a coherent design).

Basically, you're looking at this backwards. Don't look at it as if Trist has to catch up to the other yordles, look at it as if the other yordles have to catch up to Trist.

Hi Stylus! Thanks for dropping by!

That said, I *do* think that you should keep design elements from live Tristana. After all, the more design elements you change or discard, the less she reads like Tristana.

When I first saw the Tristana model on Surrender@20, I had serious trouble interpreting it as Tristana. If someone had claimed that it was a new champion, I'd have believed them. In response, I did some soul-searching, and came up with the 3 biggest incongruities listed above, as well as ideas on how to fix them.

While I appreciate the efforts you've done to update champions, Tristana or otherwise, I think you haven't quite found a happy medium of new and old. [Then there are the people who find the midriff-bearing *really* creepy, considering Tristana's previous status as a desexualized childlike character.](http://leagueofsexism.tumblr.com/post/108074787430/tristana-visual-update)

If baring a midriff is the most sexually explicit thing on Tristana, I think we're all good.  They're not giving her massive Yordle-boobs or an action shot of her ass in her picture. It's not as big of a deal as you're making it out to be. She's an adult for christ's sake.
Ziggs is also an adult, Teemo is too, so is any other male yordle. And yet they don't have unfitting human proportions or walk around half-naked.

Are you implying that Tristana is not an adult Yordle? Because she is.  They're redoing a lot of Yordle frames and art in the coming months because they were previously all over the spectrum with features, and it just seemed sort of random. Now they've ironed out a plan and they are going ahead with that plan.

Yes, actually. With her childish voice and immature nature, I don't see in what way she counts as an adult.
Not that it matters whether she is an adult or not, since every other male yordle is an adult (and no, Fizz is not a yordle) and looks like a plush toy, a fact which you're so conveniently ignoring for some reason? You think they're gonna give Teemo wide shoulders and pecks because he's an adult? Tell me, you honestly believe that?

Ziggs is to be used as the basis for adult male yordles iirc.  Teemo will be getting a VU. Rumble will be getting a VU.  How they will do it, I don't know, I'm not on the team.

She didn't have an immature nature, just playful.  Are all playful people childish? No, they're not.  Hell, her joke was explicitly sexual. "Is that a rocket in your pocket?"  ITS A DICK JOKE PEOPLE. She never was a child, she was a commando gunner with a playful side because her entire race is generally playful. Like hobbits with guns.
If you honestly think that male yordles will be stylized in the same overly-humanoid way as Tristana, you're way too naive for me to have this discussion with you.

Apparently you didn't read my post. Male yordles will be similar in stature to Ziggs design  if I remember correctly.  I also notice how you're dodging the rest of my comment about her not being a child.

So basically you're saying: male yordles will look like they always did, while female yordles will be changed, but at the same time you're pulling the idiot card by pretending like you have no idea how male yordles will look. That's just bad.
Yordles are basically walking plush toys, like fat tailless squirrels. Old Trist and current Poppy, despite being blue humans, actually had the movement and body of yordles. This Trist does not.
There is not one single child yordle in whole of LoL and you're playing stupid by pretending that Trist being an adult somehow makes her special? Really? I guess because Teemo says "Size doesn't mean anything?" he should have the body of Varus with an oversized head? durr hurr hes an adult
And I'm pretty sure just because something is an adult doesn't mean you should pointlessly sexualize it. Case in point the hobbits. Or every other yordle in the whole game.

Teemo actually doesn't wear a shirt.
His model is just to crappy to tell.

Sounds MORE half-naked than Tristana to me.
Rek'Sai is naked too, doesn't mean she's sexualized.

So, are 3-fingered (+1-thumbed) hands expected to be the norm for Yordles now?  I'm slightly confused on this point, but mostly because I can't quite tell how many fingers Heimer currently has (from his splash art, at the moment), and prior to Gnar some (not all, it seems) Yordles had 4 fingers (5 digits).

Edit:  Some older cases are actually 3-fingered again, it seems, judging by Heimer's old splash.  Really confusing.

Edit Edit: Ya, I kept looking; *really* confused by finger counts now.
Heimer has 3 fingers and a thumb.
I thought we were using Lulu as an example of what you're changing the other female yordles too? Tristana doesn't look anything like Lulu. It's the ears; bloody huge ears...

Thank you for explaining why I find her so jarring. It's not that I hate her, she's just completely different from not only old tristana, but most yordles as well. Reason why she looks so different from Gnar is that she's both a female Yordle and an adult one at that. I still say she's a bit too different from Gnar, if he's supposed to be the standard. When you get to Lulu, what is she intended to be? An ageless child, or an adult who's like a child? Also please keep some mystery regarding Veigar's looks.

> You seem to be under the assumption that we wanted to adhere to design elements... Right now we're forging ahead...


This is quite honestly the most frightening thing I have heard about the art direction so far. It shows the ironclad and resolute mentality that will be forced upon the fans and players.

It terrifies me how nonchalantly the elements of this game that made it so popular are being changed for the sake of change. League is about to hemorrhage it's player base as it fundamentally transforms into a needlessly complex, generic, and uninspired waste of talent.

I do not know what amount of arrogance it took to go down this road, but it is not too late to turn back. Heed the fans, repair the disconnect, and realize that a lot of people like this game, even if it has become apparent that a number of staff do not.

There are also a bunch of fans that are totally digging the new look and there's no way Riot can please everyone.

Also Riot's been revisiting their old champs because they felt generic and uninspired, applying all their newfound talents to flesh out all their weakly executed earlier concepts.

It's not being changed for the sake of change. The design of old yordles is all over the place, dude. compare Poppy, Teemo, Trist, Lulu and Rumble; almost the only thing keeping them together is they were short.  They know the design elements of yordles that will be getting an overhaul (which pretty much all except gnar will be getting a VU at some point) and are sticking to them as they go. There will actually be some cohesion among the race now

You also took that quote out of context, he is referring to the old design elements, not design elements in general.

The thing is that most of the other yordles are simply outdated in terms of visual design.

I guess that tristanas new design is going to become pretty much standard for yordles.
I'd heard rumors that Ziggs and Lulu would be the blueprints for male and female yordles, respectively. And I do believe that Heimerdinger, at least, has been VU'd to new-yordle standards.
Well I'm pretty sure Lulu is a child. Tristana is a woman.

Keep in mind that Riot seems to be redefining what *exactly* a yordle looks like. It was stated that Ziggs and Lulu were the base for yordle aesthetics, the foundation. That does not mean either fit contemporary yordle standards. When Gnar was released, Riot explained they were closer to their vision of how a yordle should look, and apparently they concluded yordles should be larger in body, ears, and eyes.

Gnar has a fairly small body when compared to other yordles, even older Bandle City champions, with the exception of Rumble, but he is explicitly described as a child. In addition, Gnar is a primitive yordle, so his design likely plays a significant factor in deciding the appearance of modern yordles. For example, his eyes are massive, but the pupil dominates them. Tristana also has big eyes, and while they aren't quite so dilated as Gnar's, you can barely see her sclera. Gnar has ears nearly the same size as his head, while Tristana's are only slightly smaller than her skull.

Overall, Riot is moving away from "tiny, baby smurfs" for ladies and "walking hamsters" for men; no more heads with limbs attached. Compare Rumble's old splash with his new one:
http://whiterabbitcostuming.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/rumble-splash.jpg http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-k4jpbUNJvto/VDg2iyVK1pI/AAAAAAAAa90/9Vv1YRMTczE/s1600/Rumble_Splash_0.jpg

In the old artwork he had a body roughly the same size as his head with two strange trapezoids for ears. In the new image his body is proportionally larger and his ears are more triangular, not to mention his eyes are slightly larger.

While this may not be quite so credible, as in-game representation is somewhat skewed, Updated Tristana is only slightly shorter than Katarina.

In short, yordles are larger and more animalistic than previously conceived. To be completely honest, I like the change, perhaps not in its entirety, but I do appreciate the greater level of detail.
You forgot how huge Tristy was compared to some of the newer yordles ingame.
Good catch. I hadn't seen her ingame when I wrote this.

I like New Tristana for several reasons. 1 she is more inline to the other Yordles. The Newest Yordle that game out is Gnar. If you look at the redesign for Tristana, she has a lot of elements from him. Actually she physically looks like she is a descendant from Gnar's tribe. Her large eyes, big ears, and smile really remind me of Gnar. I love the bigger ears. They are more expressive, they easily convey emotions without having to rely on hands.  I showed new Tristana to a buddy who only plays DOTA. He even agreed (amazingly) that new Tristana is so much better than the older one.

I think the idea is that since she's a commando, she's some ripped version of the typical female yordle?

*Doesn't explain the face stuff, though.
That *would* be a rationalization, except that she doesn't even look ripped. She just looks frail. It's confusing, really
She's a Yordle. She's a member of the short, wacky race in a fantasy setting, not to mention part of a character role known for being squishy. She probably isn't gonna look ripped either way. :P

Like human beings, I can imagine Yordles would have variations in their aesthetics that would allow them individual differences. I think the new Trist looks enough like a Yordle (in fact, I think they nailed the Yordle look) that most players will immediately realized she is one.
tristana now looks as repugnant as her kit. i find it kindof fitting.
Riot Trist DOESNT LOOK LIKE PHREAK ANYMORE WHAT TO DO?!?!?!?!?!?!!?!?!?!?!?!?????????

Overall it's a great VU. I only have one tiny issue...


She looks too much like Gnar.
